messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] unschooled adults was:Re: Junk Food/TV
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/14/03 9:44:57 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Lynda, this is so interesting I always enjoy hearing from unschooled adults. Fascinating.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/14/03 9:44:57 AM Eastern Standard Time,
lelie@... writes:

> >>. If ever
> I knew someone who was raised in an "unschooling" way, it is me (and
> my sister). As a testimonial to unschooling, here I am repeating
> much of it, but I can tell you the many pitfalls, we experienced.
> This would require quite a long essay - maybe I will find the time to
> write it one day :) but not likely, as one of the pitfalls of my
> unschooling history is, lots of good ideas but no self-regulation to
> put them into effect!!! In peace - Lynda<<

Lynda, this is so interesting I always enjoy hearing from unschooled adults.
Fascinating. What do you mean when you say "'unschooling' way." Can you
explain in a little more detail. All the folks I have met have been willing
to put in the time and effort if the goal was important enough. And lead
very fulfilled lives college or not. This has not been your experience?
Pam G.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
